title: Regarding El Capitan Mac users
body:
Does anyone know (those who use mac) about the new Metal system being implimented for mac. Apparently it's supposed to boost Gaming performance a lot. I just upgraded to El Capitan, and was wondering about this new thing. Not even sure if we download it, or it's an automatic thing, or what

Some help would be great!

replies.body:
Hey there,

From what I can find Apple's Metal is roughly analogous to technologies like DirectX 12, designed to improve performance by reducing driver overhead.

Right now not many Games/Software support Metal and probably won't for quite a while, I've attached some performance benchmarks showing FPS gains (and some losses).

[Mac Mini, Intel HD 4000](http://cdn.arstechnica.net/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/OS-X-10.11-Metal.001-980x720.png)
[iMac, Nvidia GeForce GTX 680MX](http://cdn.arstechnica.net/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/OS-X-10.11-Metal.003-980x720.png)
[Macbook Pro, Intel Iris Pro 5200](http://cdn.arstechnica.net/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/OS-X-10.11-Metal.005-980x720.png)
[2015 Macbook, Intel HD 5300](http://cdn.arstechnica.net/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/OS-X-10.11-Metal.007-980x720.png)
[iPhone 6S](http://cdn.arstechnica.net/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/OS-X-10.11-Metal.010-980x720.png)

You can read more in this [Ars Technica article about Metal](http://arstechnica.com/apple/2015/10/metal-performance-in-os-x-el-capitan-sometimes-great-often-mixed/).

So what your saying is it will be available as some sort of downloadable application? Or some sort of software update to improve your mac? I'm just having some trouble grasping the fundamentals of this. 
Sorry if I sound a bit stupid lol.....

My understanding is that it is currently bundled with El Capitan, right now there are no applications that benefit from Metal, however there will more than likely be some applications that will take advantage of it in the future instead of utilising DirectX or OpenGL for rendering.
Do feel free to ask any further questions if you'd like.
